div.p:
Students, Parents, and Staff working together
to build a solid foundation for Lifelong Learning

hr.h3: Regular Meeting April 8, 2020 6:00 P.M. Digital Meeting--see instructions below

a.span: Oregon Schools CLOSED for 19-20 School Year

div.p: In response to continued efforts due to COVID-19, Oregon's Governor announced on April 8 that all schools will be closed for the rest of the 2019-20 school year. View the Governor's Press Release. The Oregon Department of Education provided Graduation Pathways 2020 for Seniors and Distance Learning for All Guidance.
Union School District will continue to provide updates on our website.

We are happy to report that the Union School-Based Health Center (SBHC) Mental Health Counseling services are still available! In order to comply with social distancing, Tylo will be available for scheduled appointments by phone or video conferencing.

To set up an appointment, please call Tylo at 208-312-9052 or the SBHC office at 541-562-9418. If you reach our voice mail, please include your name, date of birth and the best phone number to reach you on directly, and Tylo or our staff will return your call as soon as we are able.

Online, blended and independent school options: remain enrolled as students of the Union School District, while accessing a personalized and autonomous school program that will meet unique learning needs. Access InterMountain Online: Union

p.a: View all openings at Union School District

a.span: Today, tomorrow, next month, next year. #WeWillPlayAgain

span.content: Today, tomorrow, next month, next year. #WeWillPlayAgain

div.p: On the OSAA Live mobile app, OSAA has created #WeWillPlayAgain FanCam filters for everyone to show their school pride. You will have the ability to easily post them on your personal social media accounts. OSAA staff will then select the best pictures and send them OSAA Nike gear. The app is available for download in the Apple App Store or on Google Play. Direct links to download are also available here: http://www.osaa.org/app
Union KG-6 Elementary
116 West Dearborn
Union, OR 97883

ul.li: Copy of official State Birth Certificate (Not Hospital Certificate--No exceptions must have office state issued Birth Certificate to start school)
Certification of dental screening from a licensed dentist or dental hygienist a minimum of six (6) months prior to August 24, 2020
Students must be 5 years old by Sept 1st
Up to date Oregon Certificate of Immunization

div.p: Return completed packets with original Birth Certificate (must see original --we will make a copy at the time of registration) to:
Julie Baxter, Union Elementary

div.p: If you have recently been Laid Off/Lost Hours/Had Less Pay and lost Health Insurance, Northeast Oregon Network is offering FREE help.
Si Recientemente Ha Tenido o Sido Despedido de un trabajo Recorte de horas/menos paga Pérdida de seguro de salud Tiene preguntas ***GRATIS*** Ayuda con el seguro de salud está disponible por teléfono

a.span: Lunch and Breakfast Free--18 and younger

span.content: Lunch and Breakfast Free--18 and younger

div.p: We will have lunch and breakfast available for any student 18 and younger for free. They can pick it up at the school from 12noon to 12:30pm. They just need to call the school office if they plan on doing this to let us know how many

a.span: Learning Resources pick up and drop off

span.content: Learning Resources pick up and drop off

div.p: Reminder to parents that packets and learning resources pick up and drop off day for elementary is Wednesday from 7:30am to 6:30pm near the S.E. Miller gym by the playground.

a.span: Tech Support Phone Line Available during School Closure

span.content: Tech Support Phone Line Available during School Closure

div.p: The InterMountain ESD has created a Technology Support Phone Line for students and families who may need help with technical issues related to online supplemental learning during the school closure. Technicians will support callers remotely to assist with issues related to schoolwork.

a.title: Tech Support Phone Line Available during School Closure

SafeOregon is a program created for Oregon students, parents, school staff and community members to report and respond to student safety threats. Tips can be submitted through email, phone call or text, mobile app or the web portal. Tips are confidential and can be made anonymously. To learn more, visit SafeOregon.
